message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product. I think you'll really like it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100.
I'm interested in the product, but $100 is a bit steep for me. Would you be willing to consider $90?
I understand you're looking to get a good deal, Bob. However, I've got to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll counteroffer at $95.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $85?
I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can do a bit better than that, but I'm not going to go all the way to $80. How about $92.50?
I'm getting close, but I still need to make a bit more of a dent in the price. Would you be willing to consider $87.50?
I'm not willing to go below $90, Bob. That's my minimum. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so how about $91?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $89?
I'm getting a bit tired of going back and forth, Bob. I'll make one last offer. I'll meet you at $90, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I understand you're getting tired of negotiating, but I'm still not comfortable with $90. I'm willing to meet you halfway one more time. Would you be willing to consider $88?
